Given the sets \(A = {@A@}, \, B = {@B@},\) and \(C = {@C@}\).

The universal set must contain all the elements from the sets \(A,\, B\), and \(C\).

\(U={@universal_set_2@}\): This set contains all the elements from the sets \(A,\, B,\) and \(C\)
